title: Interval of time with greatest momentum

Cart <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> of mass <math alttext="m sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> travels along a horizontal surface with a constant speed in the positive horizontal direction. Cart <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> then collides with cart <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> of mass <math alttext="M sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, which was initially at rest. After the collision, cart <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> has a positive velocity. Immediately after the collision, cart <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and cart <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> could have one of three final velocities that are indicated in the table. In all scenarios, the total momentum of the two-cart system is the same before and after the collision.
content.question: Assume that the collision in each scenario is elastic. A graph of the magnitude of the force exerted on Cart <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of time for scenario 1 is shown. During which interval of time does the magnitude of the momentum of Cart <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> change the most?

choices.label: <math alttext="0 seconds " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.</mn><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace></mrow></mstyle><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>s</mi></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="0.002 second " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.002</mn><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace></mrow></mstyle><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="0.004 second " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.004</mn><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace></mrow></mstyle><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="0.006 second " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.006</mn><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace></mrow></mstyle><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="0.008 second " overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>0.008</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="0.010 second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>0.010</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>
The change in momentum is the same for each time interval listed.

content.answer: <math alttext="0.004 second " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.004</mn><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace></mrow></mstyle><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="0.006 second " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.006</mn><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace></mrow></mstyle><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
